wikipedia_page.main: Captain Aston Dalzell Piper,  (19 April 1913 – 8 November 1995), known as Peter Piper, was an officer in the Royal Naval Reserve in the Second World War. He was notable for two events: he was the first reservist to command a submarine, and the first reservist officer to receive the Distinguished Service Cross in the Second World War.

response: *Peter Piper, served in the Royal Naval Reserve during World War II. Awarded DSC in 1939 and twice in 1941
* Peter Piper (Royal Navy officer) (1913–1995), Second World War officer
Peter Piper is a nursery rhyme.
Peter Piper may also refer to:
*Peter Piper (Royal Navy officer) (1913–1995), officer in the Royal Naval Reserve in the Second World War
*Peter Piper Pizza, an Arizona-based pizza chain
